abstract: New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg and Comptroller John C Liu propose far-reaching overhaul of city's five pension plans, saying that consolidated investment strategy could save city at least $1 billion a year; Gov Andrew M Cuomo has voiced some interest in proposal, which calls for full-time in-house professional investment staff.
snippet: A combined plan would be more nimble and save money, backers say.
lead_paragraph: A combined plan would be more nimble and save money, backers say.

headline.main: Mayor and Comptroller Seek Joint Management for 5 Pension Plans

headline.seo: Bloomberg and Liu Seek to Merge 5 City Pension Plans
